context: As part of a recent security incident where a file was dropped and launched from a remote location, an account named `fk8mq` executed `rubeus.exe` on host `vnevado-win10b`. The process was run with ProcessId__CreatedTimeUtc__CommandLine `2608__2024-06-27t14:33:27.7927134z__rubeus.exe dump /service:xfbzkp /user:lucasb`. This activity could indicate an attacker attempting to move laterally or propagate within the network.
question: Can you retrieve the email address of the user who performed the suspected DCSync attack (replication of directory services) on VNEVADO-Win10V?
solution_steps: A remote session dropped and launched a file using the account with SID `S-1-5-21-1540151660-3530000288-105586595-1517`.
There was a suspected overpass-the-hash attack (Kerberos) attempt by Emma Clark (Helpdesk Administrator) on host `VNEVADO-DC`.
Julian Burke (IT director) with the email `Julian Burke@vnevado.alpineskihouse.co` sent a replication request to the host `VNEVADO-DC` in a suspected DCSync attack.
